attributes.action: Stop Child Benefit and CSA payments for children 16+ in Education for less than 30 hours per week as this is the same as children under 11 who have to
attributes.additional_details: It is ludicrous that a Teenager of 16+ years is classed as being in full-time education when only attending College for 12 hours min.  It should be no less than 30 hours as all school children.  If a Teenager is attending 2 - 3 days a week they can be earning the rest of the time and subject to NI and Tax, therefore no child benefit or maintenance payments should be applied to these young adults as they are capable of earning s much as an Adult working part-time or even full-time on miminmum wage.  By stopping Child benefit at 16 years how many hundred thousands of pounds would this save the Government each year
